website_summaries.verdict: A great option for training your puppy or keeping your pets from getting into mischief.
pros: Users rave about the quick and easy set-up
cons: When used indoors, active pets can easily push the unsecured frame around

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 play pens and connected them to make a bigger play area for my 3 small dogs. We have a pool and my dogs can't swim. I feel better knowing one of them won't drown while we are not home.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much! I needed a new kennel for my dog & this was the only one I found that wasn’t over $70-$80. I love that it’s easy to assemble without any tools, & you can fold it up when not in use. You can also adjust the size! Not sure how well this would hold up with a larger dog, but it stays up just fine for mine, even when she jumps & puts her paws up on the ledges. If you have a rowdier dog, I’d imagine this might slide all over the place so I would recommend having this on non-slip carpet or a rug of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: Casey B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and as described
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, well packaged. Sturdy and as described. Working well for puppy exercise yard. Versatile in being able to change the size and shape easily with the hinged sections. Weighty enough to stand up to puppy play and pressure, but not too heavy to carry single handedly when folded. When puppies get too big to use this exercise yard, it will be used to screen my raised garden beds from cats and squirrels. Nice black color to the wire has held up even with puppy teeth trying to chew on it. Good value for the price. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces. Really mad.
customer_reviews.text: What a rip off. Did not include *anything* to close it with so I'll have to use something like tacky zip ties, as if having to have this thing in my house isn't an eyesore enough. Now it won't be portable unless I bring zip ties and scissors with me. Don't buy this. You don't know what you'll actually get in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ashandthefam215

customer_reviews.title: Good for young puppies
customer_reviews.text: This is good for young puppies. I got this for my 8 week old husky and it has been a great way to keep him and my great dane separated while the puppy tries to eat and if he has an accident he can simply go on the pee pad we have inside it. It folds and sets up easy with closing clips and stakes for outside use. My only issue with it is it isn't super tall and after having my puppy for 6 days he literally climbed it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good exercise pen for fencing in small dogs
customer_reviews.text: These pens have many uses and they are easy to put up and change around ; I have several and have marked off areas of my yard to put the dogs in and they have been great, unfortunately I have left them out for the last year through sun, wind, snow, rain etc and they have held up but they will rust from the weather after a couple of years, so bring them in during the winter!
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: My old apartment had an area that was easy to close off with a baby gate
customer_reviews.text: My old apartment had an area that was easy to close off with a baby gate, but my new apartment doesn't. My dog was getting into my shoes, the carpet, and more. I have this attached to his crate, so he has basically his room and a porch in the living room. It's great! I feel like he has plenty of room to play and have his water out while I'm away. When I get home, I keep it all connected, but I fold it in on itself to greatly reduce the area it takes up. Super convenient and I'm very thankful for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Works for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We don't use this in the circle form you see on the picture. It's secured behind a small hutch on one end and dresser on the other. Being open, it gives the dog much more space to wander around and move when we aren't home. It is a little shaky, using it in this unorthodox way, so I keep a kitchen chair propped so the dog can't move the fence. It works well for our needs this way. We fold it away each day, which is a bit awkward with the panels width. But, what do you expect. For it to work the way it should, it needs to be that way.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well as a Pet Gate
customer_reviews.text: This has worked really well to use as a barrier across a large archway to keep out a puppy. Also used to keep the puppy away from the greyhound and her bed. Haven't used it for its original purpose, but it's worked well for us in these modified usages. Well made, too. One star was taken off because we have hardwood floors and there were no small cushions to attach to the bottom so the floosr don't end up scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Roz Frasier

customer_reviews.title: Not for ferrets
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this to block a section of my deck that has cut outs at the bottom to allow water to run off. I like to let me ferrets run out there so they can stretch out their little bodies. Unfortunately the bars are too far part. My ferrets can run right through the fencing like they're the T-1000 Terminator, it doesn't even slow them down. It doesn't really matter because I just used this fence to hold up another fencing panel I took apart from something else. It's not for ferrets unless you're prepared to do some work but it's actually pretty nice. Came assembled and ready to use out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Fuzzy Ferret

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to limit mobility
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my veterinarian requested that we limit our dogs mobility due to surgery. She's a 90 pound golden retriever and this has enough room for her bed and her food/water bowls. Other than standing and turning around there is no additional room so if you are needing more than that you would need to purchase a bigger system. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kama

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I ordered two to create a makeshift fence in the backyard. The panels are preassembled and neatly fold and unfold. There are spike/pin things that help to stabilize the fence to the ground. Also enclosed were three clips, like you would have at the end of a leash. I used them to attach the two playpens together. Sturdy and well made. A great purchase for the price. I'm considering ordering two more to surround the entire back patio.
customer_reviews.author: dzh1313

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have spent the extra $10-$15 to get one with better quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this playpen because I wanted to get a new one with a door. The one I had previously is much sturdier and well built. My puppy can push this one around the kitchen with ease. The door is also inconsistently tough to open and close. The cage is overall flimsy and cheaply made. I wish I would have spent the extra $10-$15 to get one with better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Wright

customer_reviews.title: so I think this would only be good for outdoors where you could sink the hooks in ...
customer_reviews.text: I realized there really isn't a way to use it indoors, so I think this would only be good for outdoors where you could sink the hooks in grass. I wound up taping it to the floor but it didn't work well at all. It was a little too short too for my misbehaving puppy and he was very small. Even he was able to jump out a few times, so it would need a top if you really wanted to secure a dog- but then you're better off buying a different product. It's a bit flimsy and loud and annoying when the dog crashes into it- makes a metallic clanging noise.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new puppy owner and wasn't really sure what I needed. This pen got good reviews so I went with it and I'm super happy I did! It's light & comes out of the box ready to use, just close up the pen with the clips provided and you're good to go. I'm amazed that it doesn't fall over when my pup stands up and leans on it and she's not a small puppy...retriever/shepard mix. I like that I can manipulate it to the shape that works for me in my little kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: 1happyhikinchik

customer_reviews.title: Good way to keep my small dog from wandering outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Good way to keep my small dog from wandering outside when I'm working in the garage. At 24" high, it's easy for me to step over when needed. It's light, easy to move, and set up. I have another one in the house to restrict the dog from certain areas of the house. They are relatively inexpensive and very portable so if I need another one, I won't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Fox

customer_reviews.title: Tired of chasing your new pet around the house?
customer_reviews.text: Everybody but our pup likes the exercise pen. I would like to see the manufacturer add some non-skid feet to this so it wouldn't slide around quite so easily on smooth floor surfaces. Obviously stakes could be used outdoors and it will hold still on carpeted floors but who puts a young dog on carpet? The door system is not completely dog proof: our puppy has escaped a few times. Reasonably priced, well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this gate
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this gate. I use it for my foster babies. Perfect spot to contain them in with room to walk, potty and eat and sleep. Works great outside with the ground stakes. Only draw back is inside there's nothing keeping it in place except to put between furniture. I had a foster pup learn he could stand up and push it across the floor. I have hardwood floor so carpet maybe different. Also love the gate - easy access in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great to confine puppies inside or out
customer_reviews.text: I love our exercise pen. We have it inside to confine our new puppies to one area. It's large enough to accommodate two puppies, a potty area and toys/bowls. We attached the two ends to the kennels to make extra room without having to put the kennel actually "inside" the pen. It is easy for even very small puppies to push this around inside, as there isn't a way to actually pin it to the floor indoors. We ended up taking weight lifting weights and placing in the corners to keep the shape. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sizes
customer_reviews.text: I love the way you can configure it different ways. It's big enough for my two small dogs to play in without worrying about them getting into trouble, or small enough for one dog to sleep alone, on her bed alone. I like the stakes that come with it, perfect for when we go to the beach!!!
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Pet Sitting with Confidence!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few time for pet sitting and its working out great as we foster small dogs as well. Perfect size for 2 small dogs for a Apartment best part you can add more Playpens to double your size, best feature is the gate.. all for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: Michael Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: More than one use
customer_reviews.text: My kids wanted a pet. I said they could have a hamster, they came home with a dog that looked like a hamster. Close enough I guess... We haven't used this as a round enclosure but instead as a way to block off areas of the backyard where the pup-a-doodle is allowed to run. It works well for what we need although I've deducted 1 star since its starting to rust in some areas (wish it had a better paint coating). I appreciated the fact that it came with ground stakes so in the event we use it as a pen, its unlikely to get pushed around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Run Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Its great. We started using it again as a blockade ...
customer_reviews.text: except for the fact that a three month old puppy climbed over it. Its great. We started using it again as a blockade in the garage door or to keep dog out of things. we use it all over the house and it works great. Luckily my dog forgot she climbed over. She could probably just jump it now. and its cheap. Thats always a plus
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to keep my 2 ducks contained while ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my 2 ducks contained while in a temporary house between an out of state move. It worked so well and gave them a ton of room to move around. Now that we have moved a can attach the opening pieces to the fence and give them a big semi circle.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my rabbit
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I would put a dog in this cage, maybe a small dog or puppy as ot kinda flimsy and a dog could easily knock it over . but again it's perfect for rabbits or other not so big animals.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Horror

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Just recently added a 8 week old shorkie to our family. This playpen has been a huge help! He's so small and our house is huge to him so it allowed us to give him his safe place/space. It took him one day to get used to it. Already comes assembled which was fabulous! Great product! Light weight, foldable, and can be shaped into rectangle, square, octagon... Etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sports-Fit

customer_reviews.title: Very pratical playpen!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually one of the best purchases we made for our puppy. It would have been a 5 star review but one of the clips broke after using it 3 times. It comes with 3 metal clips, which can be easily upgraded using carabiners (the carabiners are more sturdy anyways). The latch that closes the gate does not get stuck which is really great and the pen itself is super portable. We were able to put the pen outside and anchor it down in the grass which was a nice bonus. If you have to leave the house for a couple of hours and don't want your puppy to free roam the house, I definitely recommend this playpen!
customer_reviews.author: Paola A

customer_reviews.title: Works well when we have to be away
customer_reviews.text: We have a pup and he needed a safe place to be while my husband and I were away at work. This playpen works extremely well for this purpose. Easy to open and move around with several different configurations to fit the area you want to put your pet in. It is also easy to store. Just fold up. One concern it that the connecting side is held together by three clasps. One has already broken... But this is small compared to the success weve had in using it. And it is 1/2 the price of pens at the pet stores!
customer_reviews.author: Johnna in OK

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't this for any puppies.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my pet rabbit, not puppies. But I still can't imagine what might happen to the puppies for those who want it indoors. It was unstable for our indoor use, kept slipping/moving around the floor. It slipped and almost collapsed onto my rabbit(he was sticking his nose out to the gaps, out of curiosity) once but I caught it in time(thank goodness!), but left me some scratch and a nicked scars on my hands as a result. The ground stabilizers didn't work well on our wooden floors. I could not keep it since I don't have outdoor space.
customer_reviews.author: tippan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Nice and sturdy and a good size - the little gate is super for the pups to go in and out. We hooked a couple more together to keep the puppies contained where we could see them when outdoors. They have now outgrown it but we keep it as a folded barrier to keep them away from the indoor plants.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Pen
customer_reviews.text: We had a female Pitt mix with a Australian Shepard. The pups are beautiful, but I needed something to keep the 5 pups in so they were not wondering around outdoors or in the house. This is sturdy, flexible to make into any shape you want. The price was so low, such a deal. Even now, they are 6 weeks old, they even try to climb out, but it's made so well. I would recommend this to anyone for puppies, small dogs and a birthing area. It also has a "door" on one of the panels so the mother could get in and out to feed her puppies. AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Deanne B. Blundy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This it the perfect item for my little pug. He is puppy this space allows him to run free until we get him fully potty trained and allow him out when we are not home. It comes with locks that allows up to hook it up to his kennel which make his space even bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Springella

customer_reviews.title: Does not include corner stabilizers, and sharp points scratch floors
customer_reviews.text: The construction of this pen is fairly sturdy, and the gate latches are pretty secure. However, there are two issues. First, the bottom of the side panels have sharp points where the metal was cut, and these would destroy a wood floor. I ended up filing them smooth before setting up the pen. Secondly, the description of the item says it includes corner stabilizers, which I assumed were the small plastic pieces included with other pens to hold it in a perfect octagon shape. However, the box that I received did not include stabilizers.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for puppy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use with my new Great Dane puppy and it's been fantastic so far. I love that it has the door on it because it means I can lead my puppy out on his leash. I've used it outside to confine him while I did some weeding and mulching and he didn't complain at all about being in there. Used the stakes the first time but haven't the last few, he doesn't push on the walls or anything..yet.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me and my pets!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Lhasa Apso's one 10 months old and one 3 months old that I use this pen for, and it works great. If you set it up properly and use the latches and ground stakes that come with it I cannot see any reason it will not work for anyone who buys the right size for the pet they wish to contain. It is clearly not intended for indoor use or hard to control animals. I do not leave mine set up all the time, as it is quick and easy to set up and take down. I bring it in during inclement weather, since my dogs would not be using it in bad weather anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great value and useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought several sets of these. In the house, I took one apart for use as barriers between my kitchen, dining room, and living room areas. They work great! Outside, I use them to contain my dogs in various areas of my yard so they can be near me while I do gardening. I also throw them in the trunk when I travel and use them at rest stops and also at my destinations. They are convenient, easy to handle, can connect to multiple playpens, and they are useful at various locations.
customer_reviews.author: mylifeisgoodnow

customer_reviews.title: For Bunny
customer_reviews.text: We are using it for a bunny in closure, to give him more room to play outside his cage, works great easy to set up and fold up when not in use , not so sure it would be good for a dog ,but for us it's working great and Jo Jo our bunny loves the added square footage he is one happy bunny
customer_reviews.author: sr56us

customer_reviews.title: I'll make this short and sweet. This playpen is so versatile and well-priced that ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll make this short and sweet. This playpen is so versatile and well-priced that I've already bought a second unit just three days after the first arrived. I've put the two together to create a large playpen for my 9 week old Border collie puppy who couldn't be happier. I'm thrilled that she's safe and sound and has room to play. Great product. No frills and does exactly as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A Bass

customer_reviews.title: Useful with a small dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my lab puppy. However, he had too much energy and enthusiasm, and he was too anxious to join us outside the pen, so it did not contain him. This is very practical design, but it is not effective with a strong or enthusiastic dog. I think it would be more effective with a much smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Great for the camper
customer_reviews.text: Easily folded and fit into our camper storage area...will buy more so the area is larger around the camper. Now to only get the spoiled yorkie to stay in it b/c he thinks he suppose to be on someones lap all the time!
customer_reviews.author: la. b.

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy pen
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a little pen for our Golden and originally ordered the larger version of this thinking we needed the extra height. We soon realized that he wasn't going to try and jump over it, so we got this version instead. It is much easier to use, has the nice little door you can open and close (rather than unclipping the whole thing which is what we were doing before), and fits our needs perfectly. It seems to be built well but is still light enough to move around whenever we need. Folds up nicely for traveling as well and fits in the trunk of our small car (something the bigger version couldn't do).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Between fostering puppies then finally getting one of our own ...
customer_reviews.text: Between fostering puppies then finally getting one of our own, we really needed a way to contain the dogs without crating them. We use it one of two ways; either connected to the crate on both ends to form a pen outside the crate or as a barricade between the carpeted area and non carpeted areas. I do wish the "door" was not on one end but, rather, in the middle area of the pen. It would give me more options when not using it as a contained pen.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: No problems with seller. This is a little on ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems with seller. This is a little on the short side. My 4lb Morkie already can jump and reach the top. I'm waiting for her to figure out how to put her paws on the bars and climb out. Next time I'll go for the taller one! All in all it's been a life saver in the house with the puppy. She loves it, I keep the door open so she can come and go and eat, then shut it during nap time.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but didn't work out
customer_reviews.text: I got the 30" size for my tiny little 3 month old Jack Russel Terrier. I bought it hoping to avoid having to crate her while I am gone at work. However, on DAY 1 she managed to escape it. It is good quality gating and it seemed plenty high enough. I suspect that if I were to use it outside with the provided ground stakes maybe it'd work but knowing she's escaped it inside the house I'll never fully trust using it outside either. So, maybe it's still useful if I just want to seclude her for a short time but it is not usable for the reason I bought it. $50 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog fence for dachshunds
customer_reviews.text: I keep this outside as a dog fence. I connected two of them and they are perfect. The connections rusted pretty quickly from the rain but overall perfect and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Just bought another!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my second playpen... the first one is in our basement and is excellent. We are getting another to keep upstairs and move into the back yard. I can't believe the value that this product offers. I would measure the space you need, as the total enclosure area was a bit smaller than what I thought (I should have measured). I set up the pen in less than 5 minutes. It is very light and VERY easy to fold up and move (we put it in our yard sometimes). Don't be fooled by the low cost of this product, it is anything but cheap!
customer_reviews.author: ScottyDub

customer_reviews.title: Stretched it out like a fence to cover my garage opening when the ...
customer_reviews.text: Stretched it out like a fence to cover my garage opening when the door was open, now my Doberman doesn't run outside and bite people. Lol JK, she has never done that, but for real, it kept her in and allowed her to be outside with me.
customer_reviews.author: twinturbonet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We got this to help train our pup. Ended up using it more than the crate. In fact we’re still using it!! It’s sturdy and perfect size for our 30 Pd dog
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Pet Trex - Easy to set up!  Using it for kittens in the garage.
customer_reviews.text: This comes ready to go in the box! If you want to use it outdoors, some stakes are included. It is durable and has never fallen over even though our kids have climbed in and out of it a million times to get to the kittens. It is sturdy and will fold back up to a nice compact size in the original box once the kittens are grown. Note about kittens: We had to put some thick, plastic tablecloths/tarps over the edges to keep the kittens from climbing out after they were about 5 weeks old. The mama cat can easily jump over to nurse the kittens and then jump back out again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffro

customer_reviews.title: Reasons to Like, Small Quibbles
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and well worth the price. It sets up easily and can be re-configured to a different shape quickly. Downsides: for use indoors, it's suitable only for a young/small pup because it's really designed for outdoors using the supplied hooks to anchor it to the ground; the door latches are a bit balky when you're holding a pup in place while you open it with the other hand. The wire is entirely plastic-coated, the whole unit folds down to a compact size, and the clips fastening the sections together seem quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Linehan

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: We got a 9 week old Havanese puppy in March and immediately invested in two of these pens. We have created safe gated areas for Charlie the pup to stay in and play in. Our house is large and there are many places an adventuresome pup should not go without supervision. Sometimes we hook both pens together to create an even bigger area for Charlie to play in. These pens are sturdy, attractive and work beautifully. And after Charlie is grown, we'll use these pens when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: breadbaker and artist

customer_reviews.title: select a size, workswell
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kennel. It is a great value at a great price. We use the kennel upside down so it is easier for our puppy to cross the threshold. It makes latching the door a definite two handed effort, possibly a foot but beats seeing our puppy trip over it everytime we kennel up. I bought it for our golden doodle, I figure as he grows, we can make it larger. Right now 2 of the panels are being unused - we just wrap them around the side of the kennel and hook it closer. When he is larger and might possibly need more room, we can make the kennel larger.
customer_reviews.author: gemstone~mama

customer_reviews.title: This worked perfect for a little litter of miniature dachshund puppies
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfect for a little litter of miniature dachshund puppies! I cuppled this with a tiny 36 inch baby pool, popped some soft towels in the pool which I lovingly washed and switched out every day and laid down puppy pads in the cage and VOILA a super economical whelping space and box. Safe Sturdy and clean........ (admittedly I just couldn't put the pups on shredded paper so they were spoiled with clean soft towels every single day)
customer_reviews.author: Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My 7 lb havanese has his own little home while I'm out of the house. Keeps him in there, and we have not had any issues. I have seen other dogs climb up the pen... so I think it just depends on the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kipp

customer_reviews.title: NOT for indoor use
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT for indoor use. It is very light and flimsy. My small 10lbs puppy can easily push it around or jump and collapse it. I can see it can be good for outdoors use - as it comes with ground anchors. Unless you can anchor it to the ground for indoor setup (or be creative and bolt it to a wall), would not recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: SF Dog

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Great to keep dog in. It's a small dog. Shitzu and schnauzer mix. 15 pounds. He barely notices the cage and he is not anxious I'm there... We needed a cage so that the dog wouldn't scratch the door when we are gone for the day for work. He's content with it :) I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly how I needed it to. I have 2 small dogs that like to play hide and go poop when I'm gone. One does not do well in crates. Cries the whole time. With this, they are happy boys and I'm happy because there's no accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: A must have for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: This has become my yorkie's bedroom. Whenever we leave the house, she jumps right in. It fits her bed, potty pad, food & water bowls and her toys. She feels safe here. Doesn't like to be left out when we are gone. I lined the bottom with a cheap shower curtain to prevent accidents from damaging the carpet. I love it. One of the best purchases I ever made. It's all one piece and folds up, easily fitting the trunk for vacation traveling. A must have for small, indoor dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great For My Puppies
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this play pen, it was easy set up and take down. I used it for my 6 puppies inside the house. Wish it was more heavier but at the time of them being born, it got the job done. My puppies are now climbing and being crazy so they can burrow through this like it's nothing. Great for outside with tacking it down.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable fence.
customer_reviews.text: Very flexible and easy to use. Of course your dog has to be willing to stay in it. It is light, which is a plus for me to set up. It is also light for a medium size dog to get out of. Easily moveable and configurable.
customer_reviews.author: Danial Mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppy!
customer_reviews.text: We used this pen for short term confinement when house breaking our puppy, and a comfortable place for him to sleep as he grew larger (He weighs 80#).
customer_reviews.author: KLB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My original review: Perfect playpen for our puppy to stay in while we are gone! Super easy to set up! Highly recommend. Edit: My 10 week lab puppy escaped not once but twice today by climbing it. I would recommend buying a taller height for energetic and/or larger puppies. I'm sure the dog shown in the images could escape. It's not as tall as you'd think!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, its a little flimsy but my dog hasn't tried to escape. perfect size and high for my corgi. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Baird

customer_reviews.title: I've been so pleased with this playpen
customer_reviews.text: I've been so pleased with this playpen. It easily folds up and is easy to store and carry. We ordered a second one so we can make the pen even bigger when we want too. I love that you can make the pen into any shape you like and there is even enough room for our 5 year old grandson to play inside with the puppy.I don't leave it outside all the time so I don't know how it would hold up but it's perfect for our dog. I would highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: vanishingmermaid

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for unsupervised puppies
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to move and set up, and perfect for blocking off a whole side of a room if need be, however my lab cross puppy got his paw stuck in the top of it once and screamed his head off so I don't feel comfortable leaving him alone in the pen. Also the bottom door latch is hard to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Kaya

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Corgi puppy to use inside. Its a perfect size for her and gives her plenty of room for a large pillow and her feeding dishes if necessary. Yes, she can move it around if she desires because its not latched to the floor but it keeps her out of trouble. I didn't give it five stars only because the door is a little fussy trying to open and close it. I tend to just lift her out of the pen instead of using the door because of it. I would have no trouble recommending it. Came fast, ready to use and easily folds up in its shipping box to store.
customer_reviews.author: S.F.

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable sturdy indoor fence.
customer_reviews.text: These are so adaptable, we bought a second one! It's a great way to keep the puppy away from the woodstove, and away from the plants. We set it up like a very wide gate, and it's very easy to use the last panel as a door for us to walk through. The black finish looks nice. And it folds up compactly to bring to a friend's house, to keep the puppy contained wherever we go. Sturdy product!
customer_reviews.author: rosenh

customer_reviews.title: My Long Haired Chihuahua loves it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. We take it camping. The design allows it to be setup in a variety of spaces. We have used it inside in crapped quarters and outside to keep the dog while we are lounging around. Our 3lb puppy loves it, because it is big enough to play in and small enough for us to pack and move easily. The dog has ZERO chance of knocking this over. We don't both staking it down since we move it so often, and with our dog, it doesn't need to be staked.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and welded latches!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what you'd want except piss poor weld on the door latches. Mine broke the first night and I have JB welded them twice. Guess what? Just broke again. Very disappointed!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lana McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Pen for puppy for some movement
customer_reviews.text: Not high enough for a Westie. Jumped right out as as a 5 month old puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne R. Iannacone

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my needs. I have not tried the anchors, so I'm not sure how well they will work especially in the dry hard ground where I am, but I haven't needed them yet. I have a 7 lb puppy, that will grown to about 15 lb, and so far she has not been able to push it around or climb it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Good little pen for my Italian Greyhound
customer_reviews.text: Good little pen for my Italian Greyhound. She's a senior and we worry about crating her because she's got some incontinence issues and I don't her to have to lay in urine while we're away. But she gets into things if we don't. This allows me to put her bed inside, plus a pee pad in case she can't hold it. She seems to like it. Not sure if it would be heavy enough for a larger dog. But it's fine for us. I will say I don't like the door. It's too hard to open, so we actually just clip and unclip two of the pieces together to let her in and out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Christofferson

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have bought this product to use as a temporary fence at our beach house. I have bought multiple playpens, hooked them together and have attached them to our back deck. Our chihuahuas have a nice size yard to play in without having to keep them on leashes. I just take them apart and store them in our shed till we return. Easy to take down and put up. Wonderful product and great price. Not sure how they would work for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: J Peck

customer_reviews.title: Great Doggie Pen
customer_reviews.text: Our little 11 week old Yorkshire Terrier puppy likes to play "come and catch me" when off his leash. We bought this pen to be able to have him outside with us and keep him from running off. This is perfect! The construction is very good, even without using the metal anchors that came with it, it stayed solid on the lawn even though it was a bit windy outside. I like the flexibility to be able to configure the pen in different shapes to accomodate where we are putting it. It folds for storage very nicely. I would reccomend this for anyone who is looking for a good dog pen at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Caryl E

customer_reviews.title: Low Price, OK Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to assist in keeping a rabbit contained during rest stops on a long distance car trip. It worked well for its intended purpose, though in retrospect I wish I had purchased one a bit taller. In general, it's a good product. The latches on the gate don't work very well. At least for me they're difficult to open and close. So, I'd say that for the price this item is generally worth it but if I had a more permanent application in mind, I'd spring for something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: James Madison

customer_reviews.title: works great, used it in house for small dog for ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, used it in house for small dog for her first time alone after her adoption.... Now being used at porch door to deck, stretched out so we can go out small door but dog cannot get over lip at bottom.. It is stretched to fit around deck and cover opening to ramp for wheel chair.... comes in handy for multitude of areas to keep dogs safe inside and out.... Thank you Prime.....
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte A. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: I have a RV which these fit into just fine. I found that one was not large enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my four small dogs for use when we camp. I have a RV which these fit into just fine. I found that one was not large enough for the dogs to move around freely, but the purchase of two allows me to have the dogs have the ability to move away for our RV a little. The pens fold easily and are about 2 inches wide when folded. If you had a large dog I would worry about them jumping, but my four are content to wait until we let them out.
customer_reviews.author: Tekmaniac

customer_reviews.title: They work perfectly for while the puppies are small and they are so easy to fold and take with you in the car ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 for our new puppies. Using them in the house and we used them at the dunes last weekend. They work perfectly for while the puppies are small and they are so easy to fold and take with you in the car when we go places with the puppies.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Handy Pen
customer_reviews.text: I chose this because of the height and the built-in door. I'm using it inside, however and, while it is handy and very useful, it does slide when the puppies jump up on the sides. I haven't been able to figure out how this could be changed, though, so it's probably just the nature of the pen for indoor use. I would definitely recommend this for people with puppies or small dogs, since it keeps them in one place, but gives them space to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great Playpen
customer_reviews.text: Really like the playpen.worked out perfect. Using it with a create. Thaks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nieves

customer_reviews.title: EXERCISE PLAYPEN
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY GUNIEA PIGS TO PLAY IN.I CAN DIVIDE IT AND USE THE CLIPS TO HOLD IT TOGETHER SO I HAVE TWO SECTIONS.IT IS GREEEEAT.LOVE IT.I CAN PUT THE MALE(BOAR) ON ONE SIDE AND THE FEMALES ON THE OTHER SIDE.
customer_reviews.author: Gromer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the price fluctuations are ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: Like this product so much I bought another one a month later to add to my initial one, maybe this is why the price got jacked up? I paid bo more then 30 dollars for it now it's going for 40 plus???? What's the real price?
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL PEREZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Gate!
customer_reviews.text: This is better then I hoped for. I use it to separate my dogs from the family room and kitchen. I also take it to work to close off the back of our warehouse. I have 2 labs and they will not jump on it or bump it. Best gate I've ever bought. I even used it to keep them from jumping up on my husband after surgery. He stayed out on the sofa couch and I just put the gate around the coffee table and the end of the sofa and it worked great. So many other uses for this and I'm thrilled. Great quality and very compact.
customer_reviews.author: labmom

customer_reviews.title: Great if your dog is not a climber.!
customer_reviews.text: We received our Exercise Pen and set it up for our 9 week old Golden Doodle. The first 15 minutes were great! The next thing we knew she had climbed out of the Pen. The Pen is made very well. Easy to put together. Maybe a lip around the top would discourage 'climbers'.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to go along our motorhome so our dogs could walk in and out and not have to be on a leash constantly. It worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Doubleday

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy but good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to confine our elderly kitty in the house after a pelvis fracture and it works fine. We were easily able to double fold panels to make a smaller area (2x4 feet) and this could be useful for taking kittens or puppies outdoors. Suspect it would rust quickly if exposed to water so wouldn't count on long term outdoor use. Thin gauge wire makes the gate a little klutzy but basic function very good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Banfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect home for my pup
customer_reviews.text: This works out great for my Maltese when I am at work. It gives him plenty of space to walk around and I can separate his food from his puppy pads and his sleeping area. I have it connected to his crate, where he sleeps. My crate has two doors so I can keep one open to his play pen area and he can come and go when I am at home. You can make into the shape you need so it works great for my puppy!! He doesn't seem to mind when I have to leave. He goes right into "his house."
customer_reviews.author: Tracy@thebeach

customer_reviews.title: These were shipped very quickly and at a great price. I searched the internet for this specific ...
customer_reviews.text: These were shipped very quickly and at a great price. I searched the internet for this specific product and including shipping, no one beat this price. The Pet Trex pen just opens and it is set up. there are several clips to connect it at various lengths. this is perfect for my small dog and he can go out safely and return in through our sliding glass door. I am renting so I could not put up any permanent structure and this is economical and easy and effective. I am very pleased with the product and the quick service and great price. thanks! Ann
customer_reviews.author: anniecolorado

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my rabbits they love it its 4x4
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of them hook them together so it is bigger is is nice size & fold up good for storing or taking with us when we go camping I now have 4 may get some more
customer_reviews.author: Beverly K Hargis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these, when my Chihuahua puppy was 12 weeks old. We have ours set up all of the time. It's large enough to place dog bed, food & water & piddle pad, (my Chihuahua is trained to potty on puppy pad w/ holder, all of the time). Loved it so much, I purchased a second one & had it shipped to my family in another state. So, that we would have a safe zone for her, while we're visiting. This playpen is high quality, sturdy, very spacious & folds up neatly to store away. You will not be disappointed. The price is less than 1/2 of the Pet stores & same quality, if not better.
customer_reviews.author: Angela H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I want two more
customer_reviews.text: I would love to get a couple more of these to take camping with me....they would all string together and spread to make a decent sized spot for the dogs. This is a great item for smaller dogs, or for dogs that won't jump over it. It sets up and breaks down easily, simply folding or unfolding and hooking the ends together. Door opens easily for access. I don't know if it would last outside in the rainy weather, as it IS made of metal, but it's perfect for inside or for dry weather days. I would definitely recommend this product~!
customer_reviews.author: Terayna

customer_reviews.title: Traveling with small dogs....
customer_reviews.text: We love this pet trex playpen! It travels easily with us by folding into an easy to pack and carry area in our RV. We can corral out little dogs into places making it easier to leave them at home with food and water, as well as outdoor area's they can be off leash. I highly recommend this product for travelers of small pets. The seller was great in getting us this product quickly!
customer_reviews.author: L. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Has been great for training
customer_reviews.text: Love that it is flexible but unfortunately because it is and if you have dogs that jump like mine I have to put something against it. Neither of my dogs has climbed over it but my one Boston can jump out if he really wants to. Works great for the puppy though and I can hook it on to the wire crate. Makes my life easier for potty training. We have been really successful using this contraption!
customer_reviews.author: SuzQ

customer_reviews.title: Works prefect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when my family goes camping this summer. While we're outside cooking over the campfire or just relaxing and telling stories, my 2 miniature dachshunds can be right with us - but safe inside their playpen. It's a great size and folds down easily for easy transport. I love the ability to make it into just about any shape that suites our needs/space. Plus it comes with stakes to hold it in place outside.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Strong, yet light weight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and so compact to fold away when traveling with a small dog. I purchased two. Perfect to set up in the house or outside while housebreaking. Works great for pee pad training on porch or balcony. Creates a protective area for your little pet inside and outside. I have never had to use the steaks, stands alone well enough for a 10# dog. Easier than the constant leashing and tie outs.
customer_reviews.author: Lois M

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The size was perfect but if my dog wasn't as calm and trained, he could easily knock it down. I'm using it to contain him for his post-op recovery. I do love that it was easy to setup and store afterwards but not as sturdy as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Aymee D.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my 9 Cane Corso Mastiff puppies contained
customer_reviews.text: This is quite the versatile pen. I really like it and it's very portable. At 15lbs each now, a few of the puppies are climbing out of it. I have not had a need for the little door since I can reach in an pick a baby up. Great investment. When they have all gone to homes I can store it with very little space needed to do so. Pet Trex was a great vendor, product was exactly as they stated and delivery was as promised.
customer_reviews.author: IdealJulia

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made (for the price) sturdy pen that ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made (for the price) sturdy pen that so far appears to be able to take lots of abuse. I wish the doors latches were of a different design because you have to line every thing up to open or close--but it works so since there is no 4.5 star option--I'll round up 5! If you're having doubts, just get it--as the whole pen set up works fine and easy to adjust/close down!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Q.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this "doggie jail" It keeps my puppies locked in, especially when they have diarrhea!!!! Nobody want's that all over their house when you can't put the dogs outside! I got a lot of use out of it when my dog had hip/back surgery to keep him contained and limit his movement. I have 2 pugs and it is sturdy enough to keep them contained. I've never had any issues with them escaping or knocking it over. It's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Balassi

product_meta.title: Exercise Playpen for Dogs
product_meta.description: Size:24" X 24"These premium quality exercise pens are constructed from heavy gauge wire and incorporate all the bells and whistles of units selling for 3X as much. Whether you have a new puppy or an adult dog, the Crate-N-Kennel Exercise Playpen can be set-up indoors in minutes without tools. It can also be folded up for easy storage or for transporting to another location. The set-up includes 8 panels which are designed for a variety of pets. Our latest design incorporates our new "Doggie Door" feature so you can quickly enter/exit the pen. Don't be fooled by the cheap imitations. Pet Trex warranties all their products with a one-year limited warranty. Some of the features of these quality cages include: Innovative Step-Through Door Access: Convenience and comfort. Instead of taking apart/out to place your pet in the pen, simply use the doggie door. Slide bolt latches and Ground Stakes: Safety and security is of the utmost importance. These heavy duty latches and stakes secure your pet inside so they don't get out. Innovative Fold Down Design: The unique fold and carry configuration allows you to transfer the pen from your home to vehicle quickly if you need to transfer your pet to another location. Further, the exercise pen can be stored in a smaller area when not in use. Pet Trex incorporates strict quality control and design standards to ensure the safety, security and comfort of your Dog. Set-up is simple, requires no tools, and only takes minutes. Some of the features of Crate-N-Kennel Exercise Playpens include: Includes 8 panels measuring 24 inches high by 24 inches wide. Easily Sets Up & Folds Down. Durable, Satin Black Electro-Coat Finish Provides Years of Protection. Secure Double Latch Door Access. Can Be Used For a Variety of Pets Weighting up to 25 Pounds. Folds Flat for Convenient Storage and portability. Color: Black.
feature_bullets: ►Includes 8 panels measuring 24 inches high by 24 inches�wide.
►Durable, Satin Black Electro-Coat Finish Provides Years ofProtection
